intro: Erigeron mexiae, commonly known as Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in arid regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in dry environments.
